abstract: The European energy companies reported positive results for the second quarter, with profit at Royal Dutch Shell up 206 percent.
snippet: The European energy companies reported positive results for the second quarter, with profit at Royal Dutch Shell up 206 percent.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Royal Dutch Shell said on Thursday that profit for the second quarter rose 206 percent to $5.3 billion, reflecting gains from asset sales under its new chief executive, Ben van Beurden, as well as improved performance in exploration and production.

headline.main: Shell, ENI and BG Report Strong Earnings
headline.print_headline: Shell, ENI and BG Report Strong Earnings
